articles.title: The Market and Applications Working Group — Bringing the Next G Alliance 6G Vision to Vertical Markets

ai_insights.summary: The Next G Alliance has established the Market and Applications Working Group (MAWG) to bridge the gap between 6G technology development and vertical market adoption. The group focuses on ecosystem mapping, end-user engagement, and ensuring North American industries are prepared for 6G integration, addressing adoption failures seen during the 5G rollout.
key_evidence: Establishment of the Market and Applications Working Group (MAWG) dedicated to market development.
Goal to avoid the 'underprepared ecosystem' that hindered 5G adoption outside traditional telecoms.
Strategic focus on mapping the ecosystem required to accelerate 6G uptake across North American verticals.
Prioritization of building direct relationships with end users to define 6G requirements.

articles.summary: One obstacle that has limited 5G adoption outside traditional telecommunications has been an underprepared ecosystem. To accelerate 6G uptake across key North American verticals, the Next G Alliance has established a Market and Applications Working Group (MAWG) dedicated to market development and vertical engagement, building relationships with end users, and mapping the ecosystem required to […]

articles.title: SNS JU R&I Work Programme 2026 Released

ai_insights.summary: The Smart Networks and Services Joint Undertaking (SNS JU) has officially released its Bi-Annual Work Programme for 2026-2027, establishing the funding framework and strategic research priorities for 6G development in Europe. This document outlines the transition from foundational research to system-level validation and pre-standardization efforts.
key_evidence: Formal release of the SNS JU 2026-2027 Bi-Annual Work Programme.
Targeted funding allocation specifically for 6G Research and Innovation in the 2026 cycle.
Strategic shift towards validating 6G concepts in preparation for IMT-2030 standards.
Focus on European digital sovereignty in the next-generation telecommunications stack.

articles.summary:
Brussels, 18 December 2025 SNS JU Unveils 2026-2027 Work Programme, Announces Funding for 6G Research and Innovation in 2026   The Smart Networks and Services Joint Undertaking (SNS JU) just published its Bi-Annual Work Programme for 2026-2027, including its Research & Innovation Work Programme 2026, allocating €22 […]

The post SNS JU R&I Work Programme 2026 Released appeared first on SNS JU.

articles.title: 2026 is the year of 6G slop

ai_insights.summary: Analyst Mike Dano argues that 2026 will be characterized by '6G slop,' a period of intense marketing hype and 'vaporware' position papers. While standards bodies like 3GPP progress on specifications, actual tangible technological breakthroughs or deployments are expected to be absent in the near term.
key_evidence: Standards bodies are actively working on 6G specifications but commercial reality is distant.
2026 is identified as a peak year for marketing slides and non-tangible progress.
The 3GPP timeline suggests 6G studies begin in earnest around 2025-2026, leading to a surge in industry positioning.
The article warns against overestimating early 6G 'demonstrations' which may lack actual utility.

articles.summary: Standards bodies are working hard on 6G, but we won't see much tangible progress — just lots of talk and PowerPoint slides, says Ookla analyst Mike Dano.
